venue.name: The Center for Arts at the Armory

item.description:
THIS EVENT IS CO-POSTED TO NERD FUN.

Public spaces are usually boring. How spice them up? Two speakers of major local spicer-uppers speak at this event.

LETS MEET AT THE CAFE located on the left as you walk into the Armory (street entrance). Event begins at 7:30.  But get to the stage early to assure comfy seating.

https://www.facebook.com/events/253493034770109/
Already at least 60 people signed up through Facebook!

One of the speakers, James Cobalt is the director of the Boston Society of Spontaneity who is hosting (with Social Fun) the Spooky Silent Disco (kicking off the Cellar Dweller pub crawl Oct. 27). He has also organized the Dance Walking Fitness events co-posted to Social Fun. He usually does flash- mob events of various ingenious sorts.

Bus is # 88 or 90 from Davis Sq. Red Line. Parking is available behind the Armory.

"From flash mobs to guerrilla art, it seems like creative people have been spending more and more energy trying to liven up public space lately. Join the Somerville Arts Council on October 10th at 730pm, as our Somerville Salon series take a serious look at public space and public fun..." 
Facebook link: above.
item.name: October Somerville Salon: Public Space! and Public Fun!
